TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IControlAdapter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Defines the interface to a control adapter. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All control adapters must implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter> interface. Usually, a control adapter inherits directly or indirectly from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> base class, which provides a default implementation of this interface.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.summary: Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A strongly typed reference to the associated control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreateTemplatedUI(bool doDataBind) cil managed

Docs.param: Returns if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Returns if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to fill them in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).
Docs.summary: Called by base classes to create a templated UI.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandlePostBackEvent(string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if the event was handled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the postback event was handled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter specific. If the control implements <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> and receives a postback event, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter is called. If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.HandlePostBackEvent%2A> method of the control adapter. This method returns `true` or `false`, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event. It returns `false` by default.

Docs.summary: Accesses the approximate weight of a single item in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of a single item in the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of `-1` indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. The inheriting class must override this property. For further information about overriding this property, see [Pagination](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b4f4c4bc-226b-46ec-ae46-00497a32f4f2).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadAdapterState(object state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the adapter-specific view for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called when the control loads its private view state. A device adapter can save the adapter-specific view for a control.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool LoadPostData (string postDataKey, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection postCollection, object controlPrivateData, out bool dataChanged);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool LoadPostData(string postDataKey, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection postCollection, object controlPrivateData, bool dataChanged) cil managed

Docs.param: Contains the collection of all incoming name values.
Provides a place to send private data to the control that might be required for loading of post data. The control determines the type that is passed to the parameter.
Returns if the required the object in privateControlData was changed, so the event can be raised.
Docs.summary: Returns if the adapter handles loading the post data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the adapter handles loading the post data; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called when a control that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface has its own <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A> method invoked.
> [!NOTE] > Different devices might provide their data back to the calling server in different ways. An example is the difference between how WML and HTML report back the results of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnInit(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by ) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can override this method to set device-specific properties. Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks. If this method is overridden in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnLoad(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by ) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Loads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.OnLoad%2A> method is inherited from the control's parent. If the control is a MobileControl control, then this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control?displayProperty=fullName> class; if the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> control, then this method is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page?displayProperty=fullName> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnPreRender(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by ) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Called by the control's method, to perform adapter-specific work prior to rendering. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnUnload(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An object (defined by ) that contains event data.
Docs.summary: Unloads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter.OnUnload%2A> method to perform adapter-specific unloading.

Docs.summary: Returns the page associated with the device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The page associated with the device adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Render(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer to receive output.
Docs.summary: Called by the control's method to perform rendering. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter> class, this method renders all the children of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object SaveAdapterState() cil managed

Docs.summary: This method is called when the control saves its private view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An adapter can save adapter-specific state for a control. If no such functionality is required, the adapter returns `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Returns the approximate weight of the control, in characters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The approximate weight of the control, in characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used for form pagination. A value of `-1` indicates that the default weight for the element must be used. For further information, see [Pagination Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/78f2786d-0b5b-4760-9616-5027357713c2).
